chargeHist.descr: Possession of a Firearm by a Felon

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Possession of a Firearm by a Felon

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Philip R. Novak

records.addlTxt: Motion and Order for Zoom Appearances of the Defendant, Defense Counsel
Proposed Order on Request to Appear Remotely

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
(Cases 22CF1009, 22CF1010 are called at 1:30 PM) Defendant Philip R. Novak in court, in custody with Attorney Shirlene R. Perrin.  District Attorney Peter J. Rindal and Assistant District Attorney Robert Stoiber appear in court for State of Wisconsin. 

22CF1009- DA Rindal calls Detective Donald Henning, Eau Claire County Sherriff's Office, sworn and testifies. Court finds transactional relationship between Counts 1, 2, 3, and 4. Detective Henning identifies the Defendant. Cross-examination of Detective Henning by Defense. Witness is excused. State requests bind over. Court binds the matter over and finds Probable cause. 

22CF1010- ADA Stoiber calls Officer Kimberly Schuch, Altoona Police Department, sworn and testifies. Officer Schuch identifies the Defendant. No cross-examination by Defense. Witness is excused. State requests bind over. Court binds the matter over and finds probable cause. 

Both cases- Arraignment to be scheduled with Branch 6 Judicial Assistant.
Order Granting Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum for a hearing on 10/11/2022 at 1:30 p.m.

(Cases 22CF1009, 22CF1010 are called at 11:28 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Philip Novak appears in custody via video conference from Dodge Correctional. Attorney Sonia Anderson appears by video separately. District Attorney Peter Rindal appears in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court advises the Defendant of charges. Defense waives reading of the complaints in 22CF1009, 22CF1010. State requests $1,000,000.00 cash bond to cover both cases; State recites the Defendant's previous failures to appear and indicates the Defendant ran from law enforcement. Defense makes no argument regarding bond but indicates the Defendant has been revoked from Extended Supervision. Court orders $1,000,000.00 cash bond with various conditions. Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. 
Preliminary Hearing in 22CF1009 & 22CF1010: October 11, 2022 at 1:30 PM.
Preliminary hearing on October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Conditions:
No contact with K.K., V.K.. (co-defendant's), J.B., S.F.
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
(Covers 22CF1009, 22CF1010)
